1123094394758811648.text: I like the term “open state database” because it focuses on the use case rather than the architecture (eg blockchain). The typical database behind a web app is not world readable, let alone writeable by anyone with sufficient crypto. Perf isn’t the only axis of comparison.

1123092897664880640.text: Open state databases are the next step after open source software. They are databases anyone can read from (for free) or write to (for a price), with incentives and algorithms set up to prevent corruption. You might also call them distributed ledgers :)https://twitter.com/balajis/status/1065462749281435648 …
